test_mms_advection_dispersion Module Reference
test_transport

Testing advection and diffusion with spacially and temporally variable coefficents vs. analytical solution The source term here is derived based on MMS. More...

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

subroutine test_advection_diffusion_mms (verbose)
 Tests the convergence of error rate in advection and dispersion of mass with spacially varing velocity, dispersion coefficent, and area.
subroutine mms_solution (value_mms, xpos, time)
 load the initial values and reference final values to feed the test routine
subroutine initial_fine_solution_mms (fine_initial_condition, fine_solution, nx_base, nstep_base, nconc)
 Generates a fine initial and final solution of analytical mass distribution The cell averaging is done by the Composite Simpson's rule int (f,a,b) = 1/12 *(Fa+ 4*F2 + 2*F3 + 4*F4 + Fb)
subroutine manufactured_solution_flow (flow, flow_lo, flow_hi, area, area_lo, area_hi, ncell, time, dx, dt)
 mms flow and area in the finite volume form

integer, parameter nconc = 2
 Number of constituents.
integer, parameter nstep_base = 256
 Number of time steps in finer discritization.
integer, parameter nx_base = 64
 Number of spatial discritization in finer mesh.
real(stm_real), parameter origin = zero
 Origin.
real(stm_real), parameter x0 = zero
 Location of the initial condition discontinuity.
real(stm_real), parameter x_left = zero
 Left hand side of the channel.
real(stm_real), parameter x_right = one
 Right hand side of the channel.
real(stm_real), parameter start_time = zero
 Starts at zero sec (second)
real(stm_real), parameter end_time = one
 Ends at one (second)
real(stm_real), parameter d0 = one
 Constant dispersion coefficent D.

Detailed Description

Testing advection and diffusion with spacially and temporally variable coefficents vs. analytical solution The source term here is derived based on MMS.

subroutine test_mms_advection_dispersion::initial_fine_solution_mms ( real(stm_real), dimension(nx_base,nconc), intent(out)  fine_initial_condition,
real(stm_real), dimension(nx_base,nconc), intent(out)  fine_solution,
integer, intent(in)  nx_base,
integer, intent(in)  nstep_base,
integer, intent(in)  nconc 
)

Generates a fine initial and final solution of analytical mass distribution The cell averaging is done by the Composite Simpson's rule int (f,a,b) = 1/12 *(Fa+ 4*F2 + 2*F3 + 4*F4 + Fb)

Parameters:
[in]nconcNumber of variables
[in]nx_baseNumber of cells at finest grid
[in]nstep_baseNumber of time steps at finest grid
[out]fine_initial_conditionInitial condition at finest resolution
[out]fine_solutionReference solution at finest resolution

[out]flow_hiHigh face flow

[out]area_loArea low face

[out]disp_coef_hiHigh side constituent dispersion coef
[in]ncellNumber of cells
[in]nvarNumber of variables
[in]timeCurrent time
[in]dxSpatial step
[in]dtTime step
[in]flow_loFlow on lo side of cells centered in time
[in]flow_hiFlow on hi side of cells centered in time
[in]flowFlow on center of cells
subroutine test_mms_advection_dispersion::mms_solution ( real(stm_real), intent(out)  value_mms,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  xpos,
real(stm_real), intent(in)  time 
)

load the initial values and reference final values to feed the test routine

The general subroutine which gets the fine initial and reference values from the privious subroutine and compute the norms, after each step coarsen the values and repeat computation. at the end calculates the ratio of the norms and prints a log

Parameters:
[out]value_mmsDirichlet initial condition at left side of channel
[in]xposLocation where data is requested
[in]timeTime
